whole numbers that are automatically generated.</udom></attrdomv></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">ACEC_ID</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">ACEC_ID</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">10</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdef>The designed primary key that will uniquely identify a single occurrence of the entity.  The primary key for ACEC will be 10 digits. The first four will be "ACEC" and the last six digits will be a sequential number.</attrdef><attrdefs>BLM</attrdefs></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">ACEC_NAME</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">ACEC_NAME</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">60</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdef>The name of the ACEC taken from the Record of Decision and Land Use Plan which officially designated the ACEC. </attrdef><attrdefs>BLM</attrdefs></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">LOC_ACEC_I</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">LOC_ACEC_I</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">20</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">LUP_NAME</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">LUP_NAME</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdef>The name given to a project that represents the full, official name associated with the project.</attrdef><attrdefs>BLM</attrdefs></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">CASEFILE_N</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">CASEFILE_N</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">17</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">ROD_DATE</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">ROD_DATE</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">Date</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">8</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdef>The date on which the decision is signed by the person who has approval authority for the decisions.    The Record of Decision (ROD) signing date of the monitoring or activity plan, if any, for the particular ACEC.  The date will be in the format of MM/DD/YYYY.</attrdef><attrdefs>BLM</attrdefs></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">ACEC_EST_A</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">ACEC_EST_A</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">Double</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">19</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">18</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">8</attscale></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">GIS_ACRES</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">GIS_ACRES</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">Double</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">19</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">18</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">8</attscale><attrdef>This is a calculated value of area in units of acres based on the area field created by default within the ESRI Polygon data structure.  For the purposes of a 'national data layer', the data are to be stored in geographic coordinates which do not correspond to ground values.  This requires that there be a standard method for calculating this attribute.   The method used for these data are as follows:  The data are projected into a standard projection such as the ESRI default Albers projection for the continental United States, "US Albers NAD 1983."  Once the data are projected, then a calculation of "SHAPE_Area (square meters) * 0.0002471044  = acres" is applied to the existing 'area' field that is default area created by the ESRI software resulting in the field (Attribute) 'SHAPE_Area'.  Please note that the figure used in this calculation is the factor for converting the US Survey Foot value of for the length of a meter as opposed to the International Standard for converting meters and feet.  Also note that the GIS Acres is the sum total of all acreage within the polygon and may include non BLM lands.  </attrdef><attrdefs>BLM</attrdefs></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">ADMIN_ST</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">ADMIN_ST</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">2</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdef>An administrative unit that identifies the state or geographic area which has administrative jurisdiction over lands, and cases, although the land for a case may not be physically located in a state. Only those states that are BLM administrative states are in the domain for this entity. Example: Montana is the Administrative State for public lands in the geographic States of Montana, South and North Dakota.  A two letter, upper case abbreviation for the administrative state office.  Attribute Domain Assignment:  DOM_ADMIN_ST  Default:  XX</attrdef><attrdefs>BLM</attrdefs></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">ADM_OFC_CD</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">ADM_OFC_CD</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">6</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdef>BLM administrative office (which is subordinate to the state office) that has jurisdiction and/or management authority over lands within a geographic area.  This is a six-digit code.  In the FBMS Organization Codes, use the six characters after the State designators.  e.g. LLAK030900)</attrdef><attrdefs>BLM</attrdefs></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">COMMENTS</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">COMMENTS</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">250</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdef>The text that provides additional information about the Area of Critical Environmental Concern.</attrdef><attrdefs>BLM</attrdefs></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">ADM_UNIT_C</attrlabl><attalias features.</udom></attrdomv></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">ACEC_TYPE_</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">ACEC_TYPE_</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth of feature in internal units squared.</attrdef><attrdefs Sync="TRUE">ESRI</attrdefs><attrdomv><udom Sync="TRUE">Positive real numbers that are automatically Sciences</rpPosName><rpCntInfo><cntPhone><voiceNum>208-373-3950</voiceNum></cntPhone><cntAddress addressType="both" /><cntHours>M - F, 8 am to 4:30 pm</cntHours></rpCntInfo><role><RoleCd value="007" /></role></mdContact><mdStanName>ArcGIS Metadata</mdStanName><mdStanVer>1.0</mdStanVer><dataIdInfo><idCitation><resTitle Sync="FALSE">ACEC Designated (POLYGON)</resTitle><date><pubDate date="inapplicable" /></date><citRespParty><rpOrgName>U.S. Bureau of Land Management, Idaho State Offices, Engineering and Geographic Sciences</rpOrgName><role><RoleCd value="006" /></role></citRespParty><citOnlineRes><linkage>http://www.insideidaho.org</linkage></citOnlineRes><presForm><PresFormCd value="005" Sync="TRUE" /></presForm><citRespParty><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office</rpOrgName><role><RoleCd value="010" /></role></citRespParty></idCitation><idAbs><DIV STYLE="text-align:Left;"><DIV><DIV><P><SPAN>BLM Manual 1613, dated 9/29/1988, describes Areas of Critical Environmental Concern (ACEC) as: "ACEC designations highlight areas where special management attention is needed to protect, and prevent irreparable damage to, important historic, cultural, and scenic values, fish, or wildlife resources or other natural systems or processes; or to protect human life and safety from natural hazards. The ACEC designation indicates to the public that the BLM recognizes that an area has significant values and has established special management measures to protect those values. In addition designation also serves as a reminder that significant value(s) or resource(s) exist which must be accommodated when future management actions and land use proposals are considered near or within an ACEC." This dataset contains all of the current Idaho ACECs that were created through the Resource Management Plan (RMP) or Management Framework Plan (MFP) process. The ACECs include ACEC's, Research Natural Areas (RNAs) and Outstanding Natural Areas (ONAs). RNAs are areas where natural processes are allowed to predominate and which is preserved for the primary purposes of research and education. Under current BLM policy, RNAs must meet the relevance and importance criteria of ACECs and are designated as ACECs. Criteria for RNAs can be found at: BLM Manual 1613 and 43 CFR 1610.7-2(b). ONAs are areas with high scenic values that have been little altered by human impact. Under current BLM policy, ONAs must meet the relevance and importance criteria of ACECs and are designated as ACECs. Criteria for ONAs can be found at: BLM Manual 1613 and 43 CFR 1610.7-2(b).</SPAN></P></DIV></DIV></DIV></idAbs><idPurp>This dataset contains all of the current Idaho ACEC polygons to support the management, maintenance and analysis of BLM managed lands.</idPurp><idCredit>Geographic Sciences. Idaho State Office, Bureau of Land Management</idCredit><idStatus><ProgCd value="005" /></idStatus><idPoC><rpOrgName>Idaho State Office, Bureau of Land Management</rpOrgName><rpPosName>Supervisor Geographic Sciences</rpPosName><rpCntInfo><cntPhone><voiceNum tddtty="">208-373-3950</voiceNum></cntPhone><cntAddress addressType="both"><delPoint>1387 S. Vinnell Way</delPoint><delPoint>Idaho State Office</delPoint><delPoint>Bureau of Land Management</delPoint><city>Boise</city><adminArea>Idaho</adminArea><postCode>83709</postCode></cntAddress><cntHours>M- F, 8 am - 4:30 pm</cntHours><cntInstr>Request the Supervisor of Geographic Sciences.</cntInstr></rpCntInfo><role><RoleCd value="007" /></role></idPoC><resMaint><maintFreq><MaintFreqCd value="009" /></maintFreq></resMaint><placeKeys><thesaName><resTitle>BLM-Place</resTitle></thesaName><keyword>Idaho</keyword></placeKeys><tempKeys><thesaName><resTitle>BLM-Idaho-Temporal</resTitle></thesaName><keyword>2010</keyword></tempKeys><themeKeys><thesaName><resTitle>ISO 19115</resTitle></thesaName><keyword>boundaries</keyword></themeKeys><themeKeys><thesaName><resTitle>BLM-Idaho-Theme</resTitle></thesaName><keyword>Outstanding Natural Areas</keyword><keyword>ONA</keyword><keyword>Areas of Critical Environmental Concern</keyword><keyword>ACEC</keyword><keyword>Research Natural Areas</keyword><keyword>RNA</keyword><keyword>Bureau of Land Management</keyword><keyword>BLM</keyword></themeKeys><themeKeys><thesaName><resTitle>BLM-Theme</resTitle></thesaName><keyword>Land Use Planning</keyword></themeKeys><searchKeys><keyword>ACEC</keyword><keyword>Outstanding Natural Areas</keyword><keyword>Land Use Planning</keyword><keyword>2010</keyword><keyword>Areas of Critical Environmental Concern</keyword><keyword>BLM</keyword><keyword>Bureau of Land Managment</keyword><keyword>boundaries</keyword><keyword>Research Natural Areas</keyword><keyword>RNA</keyword><keyword>ONA</keyword><keyword>Idaho</keyword></searchKeys><resConst><LegConsts><useLimit>For Internal BLM use only. No warranty is made by the Bureau of Land Management. The accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data for individual use or aggregate use with other data is not guaranteed.</useLimit><othConsts>Public Data, None.</othConsts></LegConsts></resConst><resConst><Consts><useLimit>No warranty is made by the Bureau of Land Management. The accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data for individual use or aggregate use with other data is not guaranteed.</useLimit></Consts></resConst><dataLang><languageCode value="eng" /><countryCode value="USA" Sync="TRUE" /></dataLang><dataExt><exDesc>ground condition</exDesc><geoEle /></dataExt><suppInfo>This dataset does not contain any ACECs that existed and were later removed as ACECs or any proposed ACECs that have not yet completed the BLM RMP process. These boundaries represent the boundaries as initially described in RMP's and MFP's either as a narrative or from an attached map. These GIS boundaries do not reflect the final serialized and authorized ACEC boundary. Data Steward signed the BLM QA/QC Form 9167 on July 26, 2010.</suppInfo><envirDesc Sync="TRUE">Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.1.1.3143</envirDesc><spatRpType><SpatRepTypCd value="001" Sync="TRUE" /></spatRpType><dataExt><geoEle><GeoBndBox esriExtentType="search"><exTypeCode Sync="TRUE">1</exTypeCode><westBL Sync="TRUE">-117.398795</westBL><eastBL Sync="TRUE">-110.705049</eastBL><northBL Sync="TRUE">48.873021</northBL><southBL Sync="TRUE">41.912677</southBL></GeoBndBox></geoEle></dataExt><dataChar><CharSetCd value="004" /></dataChar><dataScale><equScale><rfDenom>24000</rfDenom></equScale></dataScale><tpCat><TopicCatCd value="007" /></tpCat><tpCat><TopicCatCd value="015" /></tpCat><tpCat><TopicCatCd value="003" /></tpCat></dataIdInfo><dqInfo><dqScope><scpLvl><ScopeCd value="005" /></scpLvl></dqScope><report type="DQConcConsis" dimension=""><measDesc>There may be multiple ESRI generated topological discrepancies and BLM Idaho is in a continual program to locate and fix known errors. It must be remembered that topological discrepancies do not necessarily identify an omission or commission error with the data as the feature simply may not physically exist, may be a generalized cartographic feature, may have multiple correct values, or have physical characteristics that preclude coincident computer mapping. There are at this time no plans to resolve all topological discrepancies given the vagaries of possible solutions.</measDesc></report><report type="DQQuanAttAcc" dimension=""><measDesc>Attribute data was derived from BLM document and is presumed correct. Errors may exist and no additional checking was performed on the data set.</measDesc></report><report type="DQAbsExtPosAcc" dimension="horizontal"><measDesc>The ACEC boundaries in this feature class represent the original linework used to initially identify the ACEC. This linework incorporates various techniques including digitizing from paper maps and on screen digitizing. At a later date, the ACEC goes through a BLM serialization process to legally define the boundary. Every effort was made to identify and use appropriate sources to accurately depict the boundary.</measDesc></report><report type="DQAbsExtPosAcc" dimension="vertical"><measDesc>None</measDesc></report><dataLineage><prcStep><stepDesc>Original data process steps are described below: In November 2005, this data was first assembled from the Idaho BLM District and Field Office datasets. The ACEC Data Steward provided a list of the current ACECs/RNAs/ONAs in Idaho BLM. The feature class schema was set up to the current Idaho BLM ACEC Data Standard and attributes were filled in where possible. Geometry edits--generally, these edits were made where applicable: 1. Any ACEC edges that follow a Public Land Survey System (PLSS) edge were snapped to the GCDB. 2. Any ACEC edges that should follow the BLM Idaho Admin boundaries were snapped to the current BLM Admin dataset. 3. Any ACEC edges that are the same edges as Wilderness Study Areas (WSA) were snapped to the WSA edges. 4. ACECs were checked and edited if necessary to exclude non-BLM land status using the latest BLM Idaho Land Status data.</stepDesc></prcStep><prcStep><stepDesc>The ACEC tables were missing Twin Falls District information provided during the May 2010 data call. The ACEC_DESIG_TYPE_TBL and ACEC_MGMT_CONST_TBL have 31 and 38 records added to them respectively and are now complete for the Twin Falls District. Data validation is currently in progress.</stepDesc><stepProc><rpIndName>Jesse German</rpIndName><rpOrgName>Twin Falls Distrct, BLM Idaho</rpOrgName><rpPosName>GIS Coordinator</rpPosName><rpCntInfo><cntPhone><voiceNum>208-732-7206</voiceNum></cntPhone></rpCntInfo><role><RoleCd value="009" /></role></stepProc></prcStep><prcStep><stepDesc>The Sandpoint ACEC was changed from a Restricted ACEC to a Public ACEC. There are no restricted ACEC's in this feature data set. The name was also changed at this time to reflect this now being a public dataset. The Salmon Falls Creek Canyon designation was changed from ONA to ACEC at the direction of the data steward. June, 2011 by John C.</stepDesc></prcStep><prcStep><stepDesc>Current 2010 changes to the dataset: The BLM National Operations Center (NOC) provided the current ACEC schema for this national dataset. The Idaho GIS District Office GIS Coordinators then reviewed their ACEC data and where necessary revised for positional and attribute accuracy and then loaded the data into the NOC schema. Idaho State Office (ISO) GIS Staff along with District Office and Field Office GIS Staff then conducted a further review and revision of all NOC data tables and feature classes.</stepDesc><stepProc><rpIndName>John C.</rpIndName><rpOrgName>Idaho State Office, Bureau of Land Management</rpOrgName><rpPosName>GIS Analyst</rpPosName><role><RoleCd value="009" /></role></stepProc></prcStep><prcStep><stepDesc>Big Beaver ACEC was identified as being digitized incorrectly. The Master Title Plats and Sun Valley Management Plan were referenced to update the boundary to it's correct location</stepDesc><stepProc><rpOrgName>Bureau of Land Management, Idaho, Shoshone Field Office</rpOrgName><rpPosName>GIS Specialist</rpPosName><rpCntInfo><cntPhone><voiceNum>208-732-7200</voiceNum></cntPhone><cntAddress addressType="both"><delPoint>400 West F Street</delPoint><city>Shoshone</city><adminArea>ID</adminArea><postCode>83352</postCode><country>US</country></cntAddress><cntHours>M-F 8-4:30 Mountain Time</cntHours></rpCntInfo><role><RoleCd value="009" /></role></stepProc><stepSrc type="used"><srcCitatn><resAltTitle>Sun Valley Management Plan</resAltTitle></srcCitatn></stepSrc></prcStep><prcStep><stepDesc>June 2010, various District Office comments regarding the entry of data into this feature class. 1. There seems to be some holes in the documentation of the RNA to ACEC issue. As you described, in some cases there are ACEC's now that used to be RNA's and some that are referred to as both or some that have case files for each (ACEC & RNA with different numbers) but are actually the same piece of ground etc. These are issues out of our control & will have to fall on the Realty folks or future planning processes to clean up.....beyond the scope of this data call. We took a good stab at this for the data call, but I have a feeling there are still some issues with the ACEC/RNA issue across the state. 2. Some offices take a blanket approach (e.g., ACEC = restricted & RNA = closed, where others break them out on a case by case basis). This is beyond our control & I am not going to spend anymore time trying to bring consistency to this for the sake of this data call. I am just going with the values suggested by the respective ACEC/RNA field office and the data is currently attributed as such. 3. ACEC names in the decision documents do not always agree with the names on the case files, nor do they always agree with how they are more commonly referred to in the office or in current planning documents. The names I've used reflect those is the most current planning documents (Shoshone and Burley Prep Plan and Jarbidge RMP AMS 2009) and are more practical for labeling and querying in GIS.</stepDesc></prcStep><prcStep><stepDesc>Jarom Gilbert, Idaho Falls Field Office, February 2012. Discussion on acres with regards to differing acreage calcuations. First, North Menan Butte ACEC. When the North Menan Butte ACEC was designated, they calculated approximately 1,120 acres, and that included the North Menan Butte RNA which was within the ACEC. Now, according to our current GIS rules, ACECs and RNAs can\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt overlap, so we had to punch the RNA out of the ACEC boundary. So currently in GIS we have the North Menan Butte ACEC at 781 acres & the North Menan Butte RNA at 343 acres to give us a grand total of 1,124 acres, approximately equal to 1,120 acres. Second, Nine Mile Knoll ACEC. Whatever the source of your spreadsheet \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd it is pretty suspect in this case. Who knows where the 25,000 acres came from? The Medicine Lodge RMP (1985) calculated the acreage to be 31,600 acres. But this also includes the St. Anthony Sand Dunes RNA nested inside it. Our current GIS shows the ACEC to be 40,653 acres, and the RNA to be 1,823 acres, for a total of 42,476 acres if you include the RNA in the ACEC. These boundaries and acreages are believed to be correct. Third, Snake River ACEC. Here again, where did the 15,352 acres come from? The Medicine Lodge RMP calculated the acreage to be 11,120 acres. There are 3 RNAs within the boundary of the Snake River ACEC \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Squaw Creek Island (35 acres), Reid Canal Island (27 acres), & Pine Creek Island (3 acres). The ACEC boundary is drawn to encompass lands under various ownerships and managements, but only applies to BLM-managed lands. According to our current GIS, the Snake River ACEC contains 127,183 acres, of which 21,059 acres are BLM-managed lands. If we add in the RNAs, that is a total of 21,124 acres. In the past 20 years, the BLM has acquired approximately 5,300 acres of land that fall within the Snake River ACEC boundary.</stepDesc></prcStep><prcStep><stepDesc>This is a National Operations Center (NOC) national dataset. This dataset is designed to be spatially and schematically consistent with surrounding state's data to permit the aggregation into a single seamless dataset. This dataset is being compared with the surrounding states to identify border inconsistencies. There is a continuous ongoing effort to identify and resolve these issues. They will be resolved as soon as they are identified and adjoining state's Data Stewards can meet to discuss and agree on a mutual resolution. It should be noted that these are state maintained datasets and may upon aggregation exhibit slightly differing spatial characteristics depending on the originating state's GIS techniques and the techniques used in the NOC aggregation process.</stepDesc></prcStep><dataSource type=""><srcMedName><MedNameCd value="027" /></srcMedName><srcScale><rfDenom>24</rfDenom></srcScale></dataSource><prcStep><stepDesc>May 15, 2012 The Sand-Capped Knob ACEC was edited at the request of MMcCoy, FRFO Assistant Manager, to include the BLM parcel (approximately 144 acres) immediately to the southeast of the original 40-acre parcel for Sand-Capped Knob ACEC. The new polygon was merged to the first original one to make one multi-part feature for Sand-Capped Knob. The original Sand-Capped Knob polygon and the nearby Willow Creek and Woods Gulch ACECs were edited to snap to GCDB. GIS acres were recalculated for these three ACECs. -MPorter, BLM Boise District, 5/15/2012</stepDesc><stepDateTm>2012-05-15T00:00:00</stepDateTm><stepProc><rpIndName>M. Porter</rpIndName><rpOrgName>BLM Boise District</rpOrgName><rpPosName>GIS Specialist</rpPosName><role><RoleCd value="002" /></role></stepProc></prcStep><statement>This original FGDC metadata document was upgraded from ESRI Version 9 to Version 10 using the ArcCatalog Description Upgrade tool.  The FGDC component of the metadata was then removed from the ArcGIS metadata.  These programmatic processes may fail or inconsistently migrate the metadata or fail to maintain the chronological order of the original FGDC metadata entries.  Efforts were made to review the upgraded ArcGIS metadata; however the metadata user needs to carefully and completely read the entire metadata document and when appropriate notify the BLM distributor of any metadata inconsistencies.  BLM strives to update the metadata as funding and priorities permit.  This process was completed in September 2012.</statement><prcStep><stepDesc>IDAHO BUREAU OF LAND MANAGEMENT FORM ID-9167 GEOSPATIAL DATA QUALITY ASSURANCE /QUALITY CONTROL AUTHORIZATION PAGE. </stepDesc><stepRat>Entry removed September 2012 to simplify metadata entries.</stepRat><stepDateTm>2010-06-01T00:00:00</stepDateTm></prcStep></dataLineage></dqInfo><mdHrLvName Sync="TRUE">dataset</mdHrLvName><refSysInfo><RefSystem><refSysID><identCode code="102605" Sync="TRUE" value="102605" /><idCodeSpace Sync="TRUE">ESRI</idCodeSpace><idVersion Sync="TRUE">10.1.1</idVersion></refSysID></RefSystem></refSysInfo><spatRepInfo><VectSpatRep><geometObjs Name="BDY_NOC_ACECDesig_PUB_24K_POLY"><geoObjTyp><GeoObjTypCd value="002" Sync="TRUE" /></geoObjTyp><geoObjCnt Sync="TRUE">109</geoObjCnt></geometObjs><topLvl><TopoLevCd value="001" Sync="TRUE" /></topLvl></VectSpatRep></spatRepInfo><mdDateSt Sync="TRUE">20130509</mdDateSt><mdChar><CharSetCd value="004" /></mdChar><mdMaint><maintFreq><MaintFreqCd value="001" /></maintFreq></mdMaint><distInfo><distFormat><formatName Sync="TRUE">Shapefile</formatName></distFormat><distTranOps><transSize Sync="TRUE">0.459</transSize></distTranOps><distributor xmlns=""><distorCont xmlns=""><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office</rpOrgName><role><RoleCd value="005" /></role><rpCntInfo xmlns=""><cntAddress addressType="both"><delPoint>1387 S.
